title: introduce proguard file to reduce apk size

introduce proguard file to reduce apk size

Don't preserve me.zanghai.android.materialprogressbar.** classes and
class members from Material Dialogs library since no progress dialog is
used
This will allow to reduce the .apk size from 2000KB to 1650KB.

title: open the articles urls inside a dialog (webview)
message:
open the articles urls inside a dialog (webview)

- When using webview by clicking 'Read more' article's link will be
loaded inside a dialog

- A progress bar will be shown on page started loading

- The progress bar will stop on page finished loading

- Added a Switch button to enable Javascript without going to settings

- WebView do not need app's restart since there is no JS option to be
shown

Why?

Because

1) WebView shows problems when a theme is set. This way only the dialog
will follow app's theme and the content will load following the native
webpage.

2) This loading's method is faster than removing views programmatically
land show the webview on top of another layout to be removed (like in
the past). WebView will be shown only when page loading is finished and
only progress bar will be hidden programmatically.

title: Open new feeds by refreshing the ListView instead of app's restart
message:
Open new feeds by refreshing the ListView instead of app's restart

with this method users will be able to show custom feeds without
restarting the whole app but just refreshing the ListView adapter!

this will allow also to simplify the code

title: Implement custom feeds!
message:
Implement custom feeds!

Implement custom feeds right-to-left drawer layout (please use RSS 2.0
feedburner format)

Thanks to a dynamic list, and a fab button which will autohide when list
is scrolling, it is possible now to add all the feeds You want. Feeds
will be stored inside an sqlite database and saved on memory.
Furthermore You can also delete them from the list

- Resources clean

title: Goodbye WebView & more improvements & 5.1
message:
Goodbye WebView & more improvements & 5.1

NEW: Use Glide lib for pictures loading
NEW: Goodbye WebView: introducing justified textview + Glide to reduce
memory usage
NEW: Articles view: add "Continue reading ..." and "share" buttons
IMPROVE: Introducing "responsive toolbar" design
IMPROVE: Toolbar: use appcompat default icons
IMPROVE: List items design (... following Google guidelines about cards)
IMPROVE: Toolbar in articles has a fixed position and will not slide
anymore with the viewpager during swiping
IMPROVE: Improve tablets interface
FIX: General fixes to the theme
MISC: Code cleaning

implementing toolbar on pre-ics devices pt.2 & more

back navigation on all android versions from 2.3 to latest 5.1.1

- removed fab back button on >= ICS devices (we use toolbar)

- Implemented a share button on article fragment to share the current
article user is reading

- Implemented methods to get article's author & url

- Added author and date inside articles, under articles title

- ArticleFragment: scrollview revenge, removed nestedscrollview

- Implemented a method to set locale depending on device settings

- Info: added app version to toolbar's subtitle

- ListActivity: fix onCreateOptionsMenu method
- Reading mode: big code cleaning

- Styles, colors & strings changes/reorganization/clean

- Big code cleaning
